history.content:
If you want to take the UD PNP, it won't count towards your major requirements when you declare. You will still have to take 20 units of UD EECS courses not PNP in addition to this one along with 7 units of electives (again not PNP).

This is assuming they dont make any COVID related grading accommodations lol

---------

You can, but under the current COVID rules PNP won't count towards major requirement.

If you want to take the UD PNP, it won't count towards your major requirements when you declare. You will still have to take 20 units of UD EECS courses not PNP in addition to this one along with 7 units of electives (again not PNP).

This is assuming they dont make any COVID related grading accommodations lol

If you want to take the UD PNP, it won't count towards your major requirements when you declare. You will still have to take 20 units of UD EECS courses not PNP in addition to this one along with 7 units of electives (again not PNP).
Hello, I will most likely declare after taking 61B this spring. I'm also planning to take an UD EECS class along with 61B, so I'm wondering if I could P/NP it? (This will be my first UD)
history.subject: Can an undeclared LSCS student take an Upper Division course P/NP
